Trade/Device Name(s): BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System - Clindamycin (0.0313-4 μg/mL) - Streptococcus ID/AST or AST
Regulation Name(s): Fully Automated Short-Term Incubation Cycle Antimicrobial Susceptibility Devices
Specimen Type(s): Pure culture isolates of most aerobic and facultative anaerobic Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria of human origin
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System with clindamycin panels for automated antimicrobial susceptibility testing of Streptococcus.
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for in vitro quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility (MIC) of most Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria and most Gram-positive bacteria (Staphylococcus, Enterococcus, Streptococcus) from pure culture; this submission is for clindamycin addition to Streptococcus panels.
